Bismarck.General Sibley Park: General Sibley Park is a park around 4 miles (6 km) south of Bismarck, North Dakota. Opened in 1967, it stands on a piece of land closely associated with North Dakota's history and settlement and is named after General Henry Sibley. It covers an area of 138 acres (56 ha), and the site is a popular recreation spot and campground.
